elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Answer the questions on the factual text "Rights and duties".

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Name five rights and five duties of each learner.
elements.correctAnswer: Rights: Regulation of working hours; five weeks' vacation per apprenticeship year for young people up to the age of 20; compulsory lessons at vocational school count as working hours; if a school day consists of at least eight lessons, no more work is required on the same day; attendance of free subjects or support courses during working hours is permitted for up to half a day per week without deduction of salary; duties: Carry out the instructions of those responsible for vocational training; maintain business confidentiality; no undeclared work; regular attendance at vocational school; full commitment to passing the qualification procedures

elements.name: question2
elements.title: Name five duties of vocational trainers.
elements.correctAnswer: Training apprentices in accordance with the training program; coordinating the training with the subjects at the vocational school; informing apprentices about measures in connection with the apprenticeship and granting them the right to have a say; informing legal representatives if the apprenticeship is not proceeding in accordance with the regulations; assigning work orders relevant to the profession

elements.name: question3
elements.title: What are the requirements for a training company?
elements.correctAnswer: The training company must train the apprentices in accordance with the official training regulations.

elements.name: question7
elements.title: Describe the path to be taken if problems arise during the apprenticeship.
elements.correctAnswer: The learner should first ask himself or herself who is responsible for which problems, then talk to a neutral person of trust and then have a discussion with the person responsible for vocational training. If the conflict cannot be resolved, the apprenticeship supervisory committee must be informed.
